name: Boardmaker
body:
#Boardmaker
##Python 3 Module
##Chart with Ease



Create `2D lists that can be manipulated and displayed in a nice, tidy format.

Useful for spreadsheets, charts, games, user-interactions, and an overall aesthetically pleasing layout.

### `makeBoard` class 
    - Create an empty 2D list with custom dimensions.

```python
>>>my_board = makeBoard(3,3)
>>>
```


### What does it do?
    -Automatic formatting for printing the data in an even layout.
    -Changes size to fit the data.

```python
>>>my_board.printBoard()
 ____  ____  ____
|    ||    ||    |
|    ||    ||    |
|____||____||____|
 ____  ____  ____
|    ||    ||    |
|    ||    ||    |
|____||____||____|
 ____  ____  ____
|    ||    ||    |
|    ||    ||    |
|____||____||____|
>>>
```


    -Add and remove rows and columns.

```python
>>>my_board.addRow(1)
>>>my_board.addColumn(3)
>>>my_board.printBoard()
 ____  ____  ____  ____  ____  ____
|    ||    ||    ||    ||    ||    |
|    ||    ||    ||    ||    ||    |
|____||____||____||____||____||____|
 ____  ____  ____  ____  ____  ____
|    ||    ||    ||    ||    ||    |
|    ||    ||    ||    ||    ||    |
|____||____||____||____||____||____|
 ____  ____  ____  ____  ____  ____
|    ||    ||    ||    ||    ||    |
|    ||    ||    ||    ||    ||    |
|____||____||____||____||____||____|
 ____  ____  ____  ____  ____  ____
|    ||    ||    ||    ||    ||    |
|    ||    ||    ||    ||    ||    |
|____||____||____||____||____||____|
>>>my_board.removeRow(1)
>>>my_board.removeColumn(3)
>>>my_board.printBoard()
 ____  ____  ____
|    ||    ||    |
|    ||    ||    |
|____||____||____|
 ____  ____  ____
|    ||    ||    |
|    ||    ||    |
|____||____||____|
 ____  ____  ____
|    ||    ||    |
|    ||    ||    |
|____||____||____|
>>>
```


    -Edit, return, print, and delete data through the use of simple coordinates.

```python
>>>my_board.changeIndex([1,1],"Hello!")
>>>my_board.printBoard()
 __________  __________  __________
|          ||          ||          |
|          ||          ||          |
|__________||__________||__________|
 __________  __________  __________
|          ||          ||          |
|          ||  Hello!  ||          |
|__________||__________||__________|
 __________  __________  __________
|          ||          ||          |
|          ||          ||          |
|__________||__________||__________|
>>>my_board.printIndex([1,1])
Hello!
>>>value = my_board.getIndex([1,1])
>>>print(value)
Hello!
>>>my_board.removeIndex([1,1])
>>>my_board.printIndex([1,1])

>>>
```

    -Return the data list for bulk manipulation
    -Import existing lists
```python
>>>values = [x for x in range(1,10)]
>>>data = [values[x:x+3] for x in range(0, len(values), 3)
>>>my_board.importList(data)
>>>my_board.printBoard()
 _____  _____  _____
|     ||     ||     |
|  1  ||  2  ||  3  |
|_____||_____||_____|
 _____  _____  _____
|     ||     ||     |
|  4  ||  5  ||  6  |
|_____||_____||_____|
 _____  _____  _____
|     ||     ||     |
|  7  ||  8  ||  9  |
|_____||_____||_____|
>>>edit = my_board.getList()
>>>new_data = []
>>>for i in range(len(edit)):
...    new_data.append([x*x for x in edit[i]])
>>>my_board.importList(new_data)
>>>my_board.printBoard()
 ______  ______  ______
|      ||      ||      |
|  1   ||  4   ||  9   |
|______||______||______|
 ______  ______  ______
|      ||      ||      |
|  16  ||  25  ||  36  |
|______||______||______|
 ______  ______  ______
|      ||      ||      |
|  49  ||  64  ||  81  |
|______||______||______|
>>>
```
